result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarrod Paul Paddock

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jarrod Paul Paddock not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Jarrod Paul Paddock.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Harris informed the Court this matter will be resolving with a global resolution in Br. 2. Case is adjourned to Br. 2.  Plea and sentencing scheduled on 11/18/22 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jarrod Paul Paddock in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Jarrod Paul Paddock in custody, appearance waived.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant has pending felony matters, Defense is requesting an additional status. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Jarrod Paul Paddock not in court, in custody.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Defendant has a pending felony case in Br. 2 and is being evaluated for drug treatment court.  Atty. Harris is negotiating for a global resolution.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Jarrod Paul Paddock not in court, in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $300.00 cash.  Atty. Harris is trying to get a global offer with the defendant's felony case and requests a status date.  Court authorizes transfer of this case to Br. 2 for resolution only.  Case is adjourned to Br. 2.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court via Zoom, defendant Jarrod Paul Paddock not in court, in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Harris filed a bail motion but did not notify the ADA so victim notification could be made.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jarrod Paul Paddock not in court, defendant in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Matter set for status conference.  Clerk was informed by the SPD office that Atty. Tom Harris has just been appointed but is not going to appear.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Best Buy
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jarrod Paul Paddock in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Jarrod Paul Paddock in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jarrod Paul Paddock appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
